newsitem.title: TURKEY: Additional Turk budget seen around 2,000 trln lira.
newsitem.headline: Additional Turk budget seen around 2,000 trln lira.

text.p: A Turkish government spokesman said on Wednesday an additional budget planned to fill a shortfall in the main 1997 budget may amount to 2,000 trillion lira ($12.2 billion).
"It is thought that the additional budget may be around 2,000 trillion lira," spokesman Ahat Andican told a news conference.
The previous Islamist-led government, replaced by a right-left coalition at the end of June, had slated a balanced budget for 1997.
Economists expected the full-year deficit to be 2,500 trillion lira after a deficit of 681.7 trillion in the first half.
Speaking on the outcome of a cabinet meeting on Tuesday evening, Andican said the supplementary budget would be brought before parliament after the summer recess around the start of October.
The new secularist government under Prime Minister Mesut Yilmaz is looking to accelerate privatisations and tap foreign markets for borrowing to help offset the country's financial imbalances.
